noun.description: A colored fluid used for writing, drawing, printing, or duplicating.
examples: the names are written in ink
a picture executed in colored inks

verb.description: Mark (words or a design) with ink.
examples: the cork has the name of the château inked onto the side
she's just inked a deal to host her own talk show

origin: Middle English enke, inke, from Old French enque, via late Latin from Greek enkauston, denoting the purple ink used by Roman emperors for signatures, from enkaiein burn in.
